name: predominant

being the most noticeable or largest in number, or having the most power or influence: Women have a predominant role as health care professionals. predominance noun [ U ] us

/prɪˈdɑm·ə·nəns/
The predominance of white males in powerful school positions sends a signal to youngsters about who is going to be successful in life. predominantly adverb [ not gradable ] us
